abstract: American Academy of Clinical Neuropsychology will issue public statement cautioning scientists, athletes and public that research into chronic traumatic encephalopathy is in its infancy; move follows growing concern among researchers that progress in determining symptoms, prevalence of disease and risk for individual players, at any level of involvement with sports, has not kept pace with growing number of high profile diagnoses of condition in professional football players.
lead_paragraph: While playing football and the disease are linked, questions remain about how much risk each player has of developing it, and why some are more prone than others.

headline.main: On C.T.E. and Athletes, Science Remains in Its Infancy
headline.print_headline: Football and a Brain Disease Meet a Science in Its Infancy

snippet: While playing football and the disease are linked, questions remain about how much risk each player has of developing it, and why some are more prone than others.
